item.description:
Mount Kineo, Moosehead Lake - ferry boat & hike
Rockwood, Maine

On a peninsula jutting out into Moosehead lake, the trail to Mount Kineo can only be reached by water. In the summer a short ferry runs from the Rockwood boat landing. At the top of Kineo is a fire tower that can be climbed. The views of Moosehead Lake and the surrounding lakes and mountains are spectacular. Before departing the island we will explore the ruins of the famed old Kineo Mountain Resort, a grand old hotel demolished in the 1930s.

Distance:
There are three separate trails that can be used to reach the summit of Kineo. Route TBD. We will take the most scenic.
2.2 miles round-trip for the shortest trail; 8.2 miles round-trip for the longest

Time:
2 hours round-trip for shortest trail

Elevation:
1,789 feet

Difficulty:
Moderate to challenging


Directions:
From the railroad trestle in Greenville Junction go 18.1 miles north on Rte 15. Turn right on a road marked with signs for the Rockwood town landing and docks.

Disclaimer
Your response/signing up for a hike certifies that you have read, understand, and agree with the Disclaimer and things you must know.

Special Note:
This activity can be done individually or as part of the following itinerary. Please RSVP separately for each Meetup. Please email Scott at tourbusiness@altazone.com with any questions.

Thursday, July 10
Travel Day
1:00 pm D/P Portsmouth, New Hampshire
drive to West Forks, Maine
join Meetup group, Whitewater Rafting on the Kennebec River
organized by Michael Blair
Overnight:
Magic Rivers Campground

Friday, July 11
Whitewater Rafting on the Kennebec River
organized by Michael Blair
Overnight:
Magic Rivers Campground

Saturday, July 12
drive from West Forks to Baxter State Park
on route hike and ferry Mount Kineo, Moosehead Lake
Rockwood, Maine
organized by Scott

Overnight
Hidden Springs Campground (outside park on road to Baxter State Park)
www.hiddenspring.com
Note: you will be responsible for making your own reservations.

Sunday, July 13
hike Mt. Katahdin, Baxter State Park
www.baxterstateparkauthority.com
organized by Scott
our group will join members from the Random Group of Hikers who are also doing Katahdin on this day (RSVP to one site only)

Overnight
Hidden Springs Campground,

Monday, July 14
begin drive back home

stop in Rockland, Maine. Board ferry to Vinalhaven Island, Maine for bike ridding and swimming
www.vinalhaven.org

shopping stop at L.L. Bean in Freeport, Maine

Late Evening: Return Home
